reviews.review_msg: As mentioned by others, Anne is very very intelligent and her teaching is done under the assumption that you are a proficient coder at the very least. For me, I was fortunate enough to have done AP CS in high school so this class was easy, but I can understand why my peers have other opinions of her teaching.

As a person, I do believe that Anne is a very caring prof. However, I (as well as many others) believe that her teaching style is very fast-paced, and not well suited to a programming class. The weekly lab assignments range from extremely quick to insanely time-consuming. A lot of material isn't covered well in the lectures (use StackOverflow lol).

She's not that bad, but you know when someone is really smart and they think everyone else is too? It's kinda that vibe. She goes really fast, but if you are confident enough to ask a question, she will answer it. I don't know why, but she is a bit passive aggressive one-on-one but fine if you ask during lecture

Anne's teaching style is rather plain. She spends a long time explaining some things, while briefly touching on other (just as) important things. The course is somewhat fast pasted. Would recommend having prior programming experience. Either way, the course has been fine for me sofar. The tests are open book (and very easy).
Terrible professor, assumes everyone knows C already, if you are new to C good luck Do not take class unless you like having depression Teaches basically nothing in class, shows off her own programs

She was by far not only the worst computer teacher that I had but also the worst instructor that I EVER had. She does not explain anything AT ALL and when you ask her questions she refuses to answer and asks you too google it. Never take any courses with her (I won't anymore) and if you did it is absolutely useseless to go to lectures.

She is a terrible and useless prof. I learn nothing from her lecture. She only reads her PPT on the class, and never show how  the programs run. And she taught so much that almost covered the whole textbook.
She doesn't know how to teach. She doesn't teach clearly.

Shows up late to class, doesn't program in a PROGRAMMING class, teaches ...correction *tries to teach us* stuff that we need to complete our labs a day before the labs are due...midterm average was under 50...and she blames the class? marks reflection of her teaching , by far the worst prof I have had in my 3 years in university.avoid at all costs!

Awful instructor. Does not allow laptops in a COMPUTER science class, which I found pretty ridiculous. Doesn't actually show you how to write the code for the concepts she's teaching. Labs, the textbook and TA's taught me in this course.
Really good prof. Attend all the lectures and you will do well
She would rarely help you but all her notes is all u need.

Unorganized lecture, never get to see actual code, always go through slides of a huge amount of code which makes it hard to see specific points. Teaches design fairly well but doesn't tell you how to implement code. Tell you to "find out for yourself" on several occasions for questions during lecture. DON'T TAKE THIS COURSE IF YOU ARE NEW TO C++.
DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH HER ! YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED !
SO EASY! I AM LOOKING FORWARD FOR HER FUTURE CLASSES! LOVE YOU ANNE LAVERGNE!

A nice person in general. She teaches code completely in psuedocode, meaning several hours of trial and error to get things that did not explain well to work. Makes the course unnecessarily harder because of her pointless objectives and required planning. ie.she makes something that could have been programmed with 5 lines of code requiring 50.
never ever take any class from that guy. No pattern of teaching. starts another topic in between the class which is completely irrelevant. Poor style of teaching.

Disorganized, and unable to teach effectively. She singlehandedly caused me to reconsider my choice of major in my first semester. A lot of things are just skipped over because she expected you to already know. Unexplained delays in grading and communications make everything more confusing than it actually is.

I enjoyed her class, thrives to make things as clear as possible , very clear marking criteria labs are fairly detail and and practical  but get ready to practice a lot and deal with sometimes very long and confusing assignments.
class is way to hard for first year cmpt
friendly enough, course starts moving really fast around week 6/7, so keep up with labs.

Midway through the course now and need to vent my frustrations: Janice is very intelligent, pleasant, and nice. Sure. She's also extremely unorganized. Her lab scripts and assignments, pretty much every single one, contain incomplete, contradictory, and plain wrong information. It's too much hypocrisy, given how much she preaches about being exact.

Janice Regan is not a good professor. Her lecture slides contained multiple typos, and it was often difficult to understand what she was saying; she also explained new concepts poorly. Overall a difficult course if you have no previous coding experience. (Textbook is never used in class, don't buy it)

Janice seems to really be passionate about coding and willing to help. Go to help sessions and office hours. ASK QUESTIONS - she's VERY unclear about what to actually code about on tests and assignments. Be prepared because lectures and tests are disorganized but essential for first time coders. Labs and practice tests are essential to understand.

Overall, her lectures feel like they may be long but are crucial if you have never coded before and intend to pass the class. Coding projects are difficult, abuse office hours when they come along. She is helpful when it comes to eating one-on-one, a little bit confusing, but she steers you in the right direction.

Be careful if you decide to take this class as someone who is new to programming, because you need to be prepared to put the time in to figure out the labs and what is going on in the lectures because lectures can be very difficult to understand.

Lectures feel very long and drawn out. Says the word "alight" to the point were my learning is impaired. I find her nasal congestion distracting to my learning. Nice approachable  lady overall but assignments and tests really bring out the devil in her.
lectures not clear
lectures are not clear

Alright, Janice is a really helpful teacher, she wants to make sure you understand what you're learning. Her assignments are long and hard but well worth it. Don't skip her labs. Lectures aren't too too important, but still recommended.
Lectures are so confusing and hard to follow! Easy class but her lectures are confusing! And she messes up her assignments often changing  variables midway in her instructions, really annoying!!!!

Crazy assignments, but exams are fair. Lectures was really just relax time for me since the chairs are comfortable. What makes this course weird is the way the course is marked. It's 50% exams and 50% assignments. If you don't make it through exams, it's pretty much over since the assignments are separate. Not friendly towards new C++ users.

Typos here... Missing instructions there... Add some useless drawings here... and we have a midtermslide presentationassignmenteverything else.  ^This here is what I think of the work Janice does. Despite her poor teaching skills, she somehow also fails to give clear instructions, assignments and even midterms.  Run far and fast.

If you have never done programming before then it might hard for you. Also she  is very disorganized with her assignments and her lectures have mistakes occasionally. If she can't solve the problem herself, she would just leave it for you, which does not help. You ask her for help fixing code and she makes excuses when she is unable to solve it.
She is nice, just the course is not that easy for guys who have never coded before. She is always willing to help students,nice prof

First of all, her voice is so monotone which makes fall asleep every class.  Her assignmentsweekly labslab reports deviate from her lecture material.. making it really hard to complete any assignments.   DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE UNLESS IT'S MANDATORY.
Class so good, I caught up on my 9 hour sleep schedule.

Janice was super nice and helpful, great at answering questions in a conversation. However her assignments deviated from the lectures and were rather difficult. Great professor, but her courseware could use some improvement.

lectures are so boring. speaks in monotone, uses terrible examples. assignments are very time-consuming and difficult. didn't find helpful in the lab sections. mostly relied on internet sources and TA's. i do not recommend
I love you Dr Janice Regan :D. You are the most approachable sweetypie :)

I don't know why she has given all marks of assignment at the end of semester, and you have no chance to know your mistake in  assignment and you will repeat same mistake in each. First time in my life I have seen this.

She is a very nice lady. She has  good sense of humor and helpful one -on- on. Having said that,I must say that c++ was never and will never be a piece of cake.People with no previous knowledge like me are very likely to struggle . She has had lab exams, but her multiple choice questions might save you . Good luck and work hard. Practice her codes
one of the worst prof u will have in sfu, took this course twice and still having trouble with everything

The teacher never seemed to have the class under control which made it difficult to pay attention. She also wasn't very informative in her teaching skills and the textbook taught me essentially everything I could've learned.  If you're new to coding this isn't the teacher to teach you.
Terrible at class lecture. Dont know whats going on there but helpful at office hours.

Terrible prof. Not a mean one or a harsh marker but the lectures are practically useless. I was better off watching YouTube videos of C++ tutorials. Her slides are unclear and so are her assignments. Half the time she doesn't even know what shes talking about.
She is completely useless for teaching although, she does know her stuff. For an introductory course the assignments are hard. Youtube C++ tutorials are the best way to get through this course.

Gives the hardest assignments I have ever worked on. Expect a little too much from every student, especially with the difficult lab exams. Also makes a lot of mistakes on power point slides, and assignment are sometimes unclear. Even reading the textbook does not help that much.
she teaches you basics but expects a lot more on the assignments. cmpt 128 is definitely not a fair first year course, I recommend taking it only if you MUST
AVIOD AT ALL COSTS. Around 30% of the students failed the class.
Janice is a wicked prof. So good, so clear, so easy. GPA booster for sure. Easiest A+ of my university career. Assignments are fair, midterms super easy and short, and the final hahaha easy marks

Her exams and assignments are extremely long and complicate,and she does even clearly tell what she expect to appear on your answer, you have to find out! Her lecture and ppt doesn't provide any help on understanding the course material. If you are new to C++ or C, I recommend you not to choose her class because you would easily fail this course.

She doesn't understand that this is an introductory class to cmpt. It's really meant for people that have had some experience with C++. Gives you assignments that are crazy hard. She teaches the basics, but then expects you to understand the advance stuff. Overall not a good prof to take if you are new to CMPT
Worst prof I have. The lec is short and easy, but the assignment and exams are hard and long. I got 0 on my midterm and I am pretty sure more than 60% of people got the same result.
worst prof ever, expects you know how to do everything when half the class has never had any computing experience.

I feel sorry for Janice. She was actually a good prof, but she is a first year prof so her students are all straight out of high school, who feel that they are entitled to a good grade without bothering to put in an effort. She was explained concepts clearly in lay terms, and goes over things many times. Don't expect every prof to do that for you.
BAD PROF

saw a lot of comments about telling people to read the text but I thought we're rating the prof here. She scales a lot but that's because majority of the class fail. If you can learn on your own through online resources, it shouldn't be too bad. If not, good luck. and I like how the attendance of lectures keeps decreasing.

She was a pretty good teacher overall. She might not have been so great in the lectures, but if you bothered to ask questions, her responses were very good. One on one, she was great and extremely helpful. Those complaining about her are basically the ones who do absolutely nothing to try and do well in this course.

she teaches pretty well actually. its just that ppl expect to get by without even reading the textbook. if you want to do well, you need to treat this course as if it was a math or physics class: you need to spend a certain amount of time every week in order to be successful

She is kind and helps you during her office hours, and during labs even though she isn't required to help at labs. Lectures are extremely boring but kind of helpful if you work ahead in labs and pay close attention during the lecture (without falling asleep). Make sure to do all the labs yourself and you'll do fine since there's lots of scaling.

Janice is a really nice prof. she will scale a lot but thats because more than half the class does very bad. her lectures are about 30-35 slides long and very boring. the materials she goes over in her notes is very simple but her labs r difficult sometimes. doesnt give enough time for midterms and they r really hard. get the book and read it cuz i

Okay, to all the people who be hatin, it isn't 100% dependant on her. I got visual studios, and paid attention in the lectures, and then went and tried a few things on the program. Thats how you learn in this course. She is NOT clear in lecture, however 1 on 1 she is very helpful in labs. Difficult course if you don't pay attention.
when she explains things she expects u to already no stuff about c++. When i tried paying attention in class she was really confusing. her midterms r really long and hard.

....study from the textbook from the very beginning. midterms are crazy hard and practically impossible to finish unless you already have  background knowledge on the course before you enrolled. assignments are crazy hard compared to what she teaches. powerpoint is boring and blend. im sh*% scared im going to fail this course.

Nice person, but teaches the most simple rules of programming, that we can simply get from the textbook. Her assignments/exams are extremely long and difficult. Rather than just teach us stuff we can get from the textbook, she should go over difficult codes in class, and describe how things work in the actual code.

really hard teacher. she teaches simple material but then expects you to be able to right a really hard code in a short amount of time. Her midterms are meant to fail you. If you do fail this course don't be surprised. And the TA's she has are useless they do not help that much.

It's my first time using c++ (i had previously taken visual basic in high school). I had no problem at all with the prof. I notice the ppl that complain about her are the ones who admit they don't bother to read the textbook and also seem like they feel "entitled" to a good mark. It's funny though, because they don't actually do the work required

THE WORST PROF ive ever had !doesnt teach you anything , but on her midterms and finals and her labs and quizes she asks you the hardest questions . but the only good thing about her is that you can submit you assignments as a group and she scales at the end of the course , cuz the average is so damn low! do not take CMPT 128 with her

She's nice and all but she can't teach at all... A computer class should be taught through examples, not with powerpoint presentations on concepts... I think this is the worst corse I took all year, but the final exam was pretty easy (open book)

She knows what she's doing but she's terrible at teaching. She's horrible at explaining concepts. 2/5 TA's were actually helpful when they were around the other 2 didn't know**** and the one of them was really stuck up and mean.
useless class and notes. i learn it by myself. hard weekly quize and exam. even student who taken C++ before still cannot get a good mark. so many student fail in mildterm exam

this prof is a nightmare. she'd never taught us any thing in the lacutre and her TAs cant help us at all. th quizs and labs are ultra hard even for a student who have taken C++ before. she designed mid terms which mean to fail us. and once, i was having a lab and i asked her question. she said:"just pretend im at here!! go and ask other people!!"
boring lecture, long assignments, super long tests, difficult weekly quizes. A good prof if you want to fail this class.
Never went to class. Her notes and lectures are kind of useless but she's very willing... to help you, in the lab... even after hours.
O man! Terrible Teacher. It's lucky for me, since I took this course in high school. But I feel so SORRY for teh rest of class.
worst prof ever...

Always there to provide you with help, but during lectures she does not connect with her audience, her lecture material is talking more to her than to her students. Quizzes and assignments are sometimes unreasonable. but she gives big bonus marks though.
not an excellent teacher but has  a lot of knowledge in her field
She is a very good prof to look at. It makes my day when i enter her class. But she just can't teach. The best part is when she starts jumping up and down. Ohhh god ... Soooo ####(hint start with S)
Garbage
From the first day to the last day the pace of this course is going really fast. This intro class will require you to have a good background in programming or else you will do horrible.
worst prof, never cover enough info for assignments and midterms, tests r freaking long, questions r unclear, too many typo mistakes in assignments and tests...
Really takes the time to explain things in detail. And, instead of simply reading slides off a powerpoint, he actually engages himself into doing some examples in class.
Assignment instructions were poorly given, causing a lot of confusion. But he can be pretty helpful if you go talk to him one-on-one.

Vaughanator didn't turn out to be that bad of a prof afterall. His assignments were generally long but do-able, and his final was fair. He also took time to help students in the lab, possibly because the TA's for the class seemed to be inexistant :/ . Overall decent prof.

The "Vaughanator" is pretty cool, but I really hate him using the black board, it's impossible to read there. My friend asked him to write on the overhead, he refused and told him to sit closer to the board. But anyways, overall, i wasted around 8-9 hours of my time working on his midterm 3....
never take this prof

She is unnecessarily strict. Even if you do the whole coding and make a simple mistake, she will grade you 1 or 2 out of 25 or 30 marks. I do not suggest anyone new to computer science take her course. If you already know how to code, you could take her course. She does not inspire the students to work harder.
Wost prof I ever had. Avoid her at ALL costs.

She is the weirdest kind of human on this planet. she is a racist and has a language problem as being from China. you could not really understand her. there is a lot of communication gap. please don't waste your semester and money with her.
WORST TEACHER EVER
Helpful
jut don't take her course, it will make you having headache

Course material isn't that hard and she's really helpful and explains well enough. It's just that her midterm and quizzes take a long time to do and you're very short on time. And she's pretty harsh on the marking too. I managed to get an A+ though.
I don't know why I just got so low grade, before final I have still 78%, and the 2nd assignment is not clear in the description..
Awful prof!! Haven't seen a prof so bad as her.Sadistic Woman, loves to scream on students.

Always held a grudge against this thing but writing a review now to critique him on his poor planning skills. Delayed an exam without permission and let Janice make unallowed changes to grading scheme. He's a reminder that some people can bs their way through parts of life by negatively affecting other's lives and no consequences will follow.
this class sucked
Lectures are very boring.
Hard final :((

One of the best teacher at SFU. His class is well organized: great lectures (you are learning great programming skill), good notes (but don't miss lectures!), good labs (content of labs are rich). Assignments and exams are challenging but if you follow lectures+labs and spend enough time, no need to worry to much about them. Just enjoy learning!!
good
good profesor to take COMP 150

Actually it was hard to understanding what he's saying during the class. Luckily,  the course material was not very hard for me. If you're new to programming, and if you are not used to listen English with accent, then You'd better not choose him. He's very helpful. (+ Textbook sucks, there's better books around, so other books can help)

A very good and nice prof. Need you think more on questions he tells you to do and practice more on coding. Can ask him a lot in office hour (but you must do on your own first then have a discussion with him is better).Must hand in homework before due time and keep quite on class. DO NOT miss the exams and they won't hard if working hard.I got A.
